data.title: GG23 OSS - Developer Tooling and Libraries

questions.query: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds
Provide a brief overview of your tool, library, or framework. What specific problem or inefficiency in the development process does it address?
questions.explanation:
Bonadocs is on a mission to simplify smart contract integrations. We’re making it easy for web3 developers to use and integrate smart contracts into their systems.

Problem: Collaboration between teams on smart contract integrations is currently a time-consuming affair. This comes down to two difficult tasks:
-Documentation
-Integration

Documenting smart contracts is hard. Most smart contracts have complex workflows. Multiple smart contract method calls and transactions are required to complete certain complex actions. For example, executing a Swap action on Uniswap involves at least two calls for most tokens: approve tokens (approve), execute swap (swapExactTokensForTokens). Each workflow needs to be interactable and properly documented.
Integration is also a nightmare because few contracts are ever documented well enough. However, that's not the only reason. Even when the contract is adequately documented, testing workflows to observe the behavior in different scenarios is a necessary part of integration. For both solidity and dapp developers.

questions.query: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.
questions.explanation:
Bonadocs allows web3 engineering teams to collaborate and build applications in a very intuitive way. To simplify integrations, we've categorized our tooling as follows:

Docgen: Docgen allows developers to go from their codebase to beautiful and interactive documentation in seconds. Using our hardhat plugin, you can generate interactive documentation to query your contract methods. (https://x.com/bonadocs/status/1750896462882386228)

Widget: Through our playground environment, you can generate widgets for your contract methods. These widgets can then be easily embedded in your docs or any react application for devs to query. This is instrumental for devrel teams, to help onboard external devs. (https://medium.com/@bonadocs/using-bonadocs-widget-to-enable-interactivity-on-your-docs-8169b6201f78)

Playground: Our playground is a collaborative environment primarily for solidity and front-end devs to build applications. This can be used by internal engineering teams or teams across different organizations. Devrel teams can also take advantage of the playground to create a single source of truth for their protocol - making onboarding super easy for their developer community. (https://playground.bonadocs.com/)

Protocol Registry: Our protocol registry is an open-source tool that allows you to find different popular protocols and their respective playgrounds. (https://registry.bonadocs.com/)

On a high level, bonadocs are created to simplify the documentation, interaction, and integration of smart contracts.

questions.query: Describe the current usage and support for your tool within the developer community. This could include GitHub stars, downloads, or testimonials from developers.
questions.explanation:
Different parts of our tooling are used by Superfluid, Arbitrum, Optimism, Base, Compound, Paycrest, etc.
Superfluid: https://docs.superfluid.finance/docs/technical-reference/CFAv1Forwarder
Paycrest: https://docs.paycrest.io/contracts/Gateway

Devs:

https://x.com/Reformed_Normie/status/1824113289325842857

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation:
Roadmap:
1) Smart contract testing
2) Dapp generator: It’s a feature that allows you convert your contracts into a quick demo app to show use-cases - This leverages actions (https://docs.bonadocs.com/docs/guides/Playground/Contracts/Action) within the bonadocs suite. 
The dapp generator is similar to Coast (https://www.trycoast.com/) for APIs.

Internal Collaboration Editor
Jun 16, 2024 - Jun 30, 2024

Past Due


Create projects, aggregate your contracts, enable internal/external teams to document, collaborate, interact with contracts, automate testing, and simulate complex workflows.

Features:

Project creation directly from the command line.
Project collaboration
Protocol Playground
Contract interaction (mainnet/simulation)
Actions’ code editor - This allows users to interact with their smart contracts using a Javascript environment; just like they’re on the frontend of the application.
Inbuilt Docgen/Widget
Event logs

data.description:
Arbitrum Protocol registry

Our protocol registry is a list of protocol playgrounds that helps developers to interact with different protocols built on the Arbitrum network. Developers will be able to read and interact with contracts on each protocol in a single place; including dApp actions and documentation. To explain dapp actions, executing a Swap action on Uniswap involves at least two calls for most tokens: approve tokens (approve), and execute swap (transferFrom). Each workflow needs to be replicated and properly documented. 

It's open-source, so if a new protocol is introduced on the Arbitrum chain, they can add their protocol to the repo. This replaces the ecosystem app page for builders by allowing devs not just to see a list of protocols, dapps, DEXs, etc built on Arbitrum, but to also interact with their smart contract methods and perform actions on the Contract (i.e. Swap on Uniswap).

This does two things for the Arbitrum ecosystem:

Shorten the time required to onboard new developers to build protocols/dapps and integrate with the existing protocols on the network.

Creates an explorative environment to distribute existing Arbitrum protocols to dApp developers looking to build on them. Technically, the dapp developers can simply integrate existing protocols by copying and pasting their code from the playground.
